question.text: Which point of difference between Geitonogamy and Xenogamy is incorrect?

options.text:
Geitonogamy Xenogamy
It is self-pollination It is cross pollination

Geitonogamy Xenogamy
It produces fewer variations If produces a lot of variations.

Geitonogamy Xenogamy
It occurs between two flowers of same Plant It occurs between two flowers of different Plants

Geitonogamy Xenogamy
Pollination occurs between genetically dissimilar plants. Pollination occurs between morphologically and genetically dissimilar plants.

solution.text: Geitonogamy and xenogamy are two types pollination that occur between same species of plant. Geitonogamy is pollination between two different flowers of the same plant. Xenogamy is the pollination between two different flowers of different plants but same species/type. In both the types, the genetic constitution of the plants/flower participating is similar. Also, the plants and flower are morphologically same in both the cases.
